name: Salmon with Saikyo Miso
recipeIngredient: 2 salmon steaks (or cod, halibut, or sablefish).
Small slender courgettes (ideally with the flowers attached, briefly blanched and refreshed).
recipeInstructions: 1. About 2 days ahead, make the Saikyo miso: in a heavy-based non-reactive saucepan, bring the sake and mirin to the boil, and continue to boil for  2-3 minutes to allow the alcohol to evaporate.

2. Using a wooden spoon, stir in the sugar until it has dissolved, then slowly mix in the miso paste, a little at a time. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly so as to not let any of the mixture burn, for 10-15 minutes.
3. Strain the mixture through a sieve to remove any lumps, allow to cool, then chill until quite cold.
4. Place the fish in a non-reactive container, pour in a good splash of the Saikyo miso over each of the fillets and leave for 1-2 days in the refrigerator.

5. When you want to cook the fish, preheat a hot grill or the oven to 200C/gas 6. Place the fillets on the grill pan or a non-stick baking sheet and cook under the grill or in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, turning once if grilling, until cooked through and golden on the outside.
6. Place on a serving dish and dress the plate with a little extra Saikyo miso, and some cherry plum tomatoes on the vine, or small slender courgettes.
